sentence.value: Aleksandr Ivanovich Laveykin (born April 21, 1951) was a Soviet cosmonaut.
sentence.pattern_crowdsource: [[Aleksandr Ivanovich Laveykin|Aleksandr_Laveykin]] (born April 21, 1951) was a [[Soviet|Soviet_Union]] cosmonaut.

sentence.value: Born in Moscow, Laveykin was selected as a cosmonaut on December 1, 1978.
sentence.annotated-sentence: Born in [[Moscow|Moscow]], [[Laveykin|Aleksandr_Laveykin]] was selected as [[a cosmonaut|Astronaut]] on December 1, 1978.
sentence.pattern_crowdsource: Born in [[Moscow|Moscow]], [[Laveykin|Aleksandr_Laveykin]] was selected as a cosmonaut on December 1, 1978.

sentence.value: He flew on one spaceflight, for the first part of the long duration expedition Mir EO-2.
sentence.annotated-sentence: He flew on [[one spaceflight|Spaceflight]], for the first part of the long duration [[expedition|Exploration]] [[Mir EO-2|Mir_EO-2]].
sentence.pattern_crowdsource: He flew on one spaceflight, for the first part of the long duration expedition [[Mir EO-2|Mir_EO-2]].

sentence.value: He flew as Flight Engineer, and was both launched and landed with the spacecraft Soyuz TM-2.
sentence.annotated-sentence: He flew as [[Flight Engineer|Flight_engineer]], and was both launched and landed with the [[spacecraft|Spacecraft]] [[Soyuz TM-2|Soyuz_TM-2]].

sentence.value: During this mission he spent 174 days 3 hours 25 minutes in space.
sentence.annotated-sentence: During this mission he spent 174 days 3 [[hours|Hour]] 25 [[minutes|Minute]] in [[space|Space]].

sentence.value: Married with one child, Laveykin retired on March 28, 1994.
sentence.annotated-sentence: Married with [[one child|Child]], [[Laveykin|Aleksandr_Laveykin]] retired on March 28, 1994.

sentence.value: Launched in February 1987, his spaceflight was intended to last until December 1987.

sentence.value: But during the mission, doctors on the ground determined that he was having minor heart irregularities.
sentence.annotated-sentence: But during the mission, doctors on the ground determined that he was having minor heart [[irregularities|Canonical_impediment]].

sentence.value: For this reason, in July he was replaced by Soviet cosmonaut Aleksandr Pavlovich Aleksandrov, who stayed on Mir to the end of the expedition in December.
sentence.annotated-sentence: For this reason, in [[July|July]] he was replaced by [[Soviet|Soviet_Union]] [[cosmonaut|Astronaut]] [[Aleksandr Pavlovich Aleksandrov|Aleksandr_Pavlovich_Aleksandrov]], who stayed on Mir to the end of [[the expedition|Exploration]] in December.
sentence.pattern_crowdsource: For this reason, in July he was replaced by [[Soviet|Soviet_Union]] cosmonaut [[Aleksandr Pavlovich Aleksandrov|Aleksandr_Pavlovich_Aleksandrov]], who stayed on Mir to the end of the expedition in December.

sentence.value: He was awarded the titles of Hero of the Soviet Union and Pilot-Cosmonaut of the USSR, Order of Lenin and the Russian Federation Medal "For Merit in Space Exploration".
sentence.annotated-sentence: He was awarded [[the titles|Title]] of [[Hero of the Soviet Union|Hero_of_the_Soviet_Union]] and [[Pilot-Cosmonaut|Pilot-Cosmonaut_of_the_USSR]] of [[the USSR|Soviet_Union]], [[Order of Lenin|Order_of_Lenin]] and the [[Russian Federation|Hero_of_the_Russian_Federation]] [[Medal|Medal]] "For Merit in [[Space Exploration|Space_exploration]]".
sentence.pattern_crowdsource: He was awarded the titles of [[Hero of the Soviet Union|Hero_of_the_Soviet_Union]] and Pilot-Cosmonaut of [[the USSR|Soviet_Union]], [[Order of Lenin|Order_of_Lenin]] and the [[Russian Federation|Hero_of_the_Russian_Federation]] Medal "For Merit in Space Exploration".
